QuestDetail: Regnus is rich in natural resources, including plants, fungi, animals, minerals, and more. Some people, through experience and research, find and collect these natural resources in a reasonable manner, while others process the collected resources into various items useful for life and combat. This is what is known as a Life Skill.

Sid is a renowned phytologist in Regnus. Almost every adventurer owns a copy of his book "The Magical Plants of Regnus." Whether it's for stopping external bleeding or pain relief and detoxification, if you've read his book, you can always find the corresponding plants in the wild. Go ask him about Botany.

The "Golden Spirit" prospecting team is the first prospecting team officially recognized by Asterleeds, mainly undertaking prospecting commissions from Asterleeds officials and the Pioneer Bureau. As the first leader of the prospecting team, Aile has retired from the front line and now stays in the city to teach young people who are just getting into prospecting. Be careful, he is very strict.

With the emergence of Gemology and Gemcrafting, members of the "Golden Spirit" Prospecting Team led by Safia concluded that clinging to traditional methods would result in stagnation. They departed to form the "Brilliant Crystals" Research Team. Safiya is likely the most knowledgeable person about crystals in all of Asterleeds. Speak with her to learn about Gemology.
The Artisan Guild claims that with the ancient relic "Orb Refining Device," they can create many items beneficial for adventuring. Go to the Artisan Guild to learn more.

Once, there was a renowned master carpenter in Asterleeds who led the post-war reconstruction. Perhaps due to his age or the toll of the demanding work, he passed away after getting the city through the toughest time. His adopted son, also his apprentice, took over his work. Go find Cicero to learn more about Artisanry.

Spin the wool of Caprahorns into yarn, extract plant pigments to make natural dyes, and weave dyed yarns into carpets with intricate patterns... Each beautiful carpet involves a complex process. If you want to learn more about weaving, go talk to Maina.
